name.description: The name of the custom header.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to

profile_name.description: The name of the Traffic Manager Profile to attach

endpoint_status.description: The status of the Endpoint, can be set to

type.description: The Endpoint type, must be one of:

target.description: The FQDN DNS name of the target. This argument must be

target_resource_id.description: The resource id of an Azure resource to

weight.description: Specifies how much traffic should be distributed to this

priority.description: Specifies the priority of this Endpoint, this must be

endpoint_location.description: Specifies the Azure location of the Endpoint,

min_child_endpoints.description: This argument specifies the minimum number

geo_mappings.description: A list of Geographic Regions used to distribute traffic, such as `WORLD`, `UK` or `DE`. The same location can't be specified in two endpoints. [See the Geographic Hierarchies documentation for more information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/trafficmanager/geographichierarchies/getdefault).

custom_header.description: One or more `custom_header` blocks as defined below

subnet.description: One or more `subnet` blocks as defined below

value.description: The value of custom header. Applicable for Http and Https protocol.

scope.notes: One and only one of either `last` (in case of IP range) or `scope` (in case of CIDR) must be specified.

id.description: The ID of the Traffic Manager Endpoint.

create.description: Used when creating the Traffic Manager Endpoint.

update.description: Used when updating the Traffic Manager Endpoint.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Traffic Manager Endpoint.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Traffic Manager Endpoint.
